5.text:
First, we have Kronos, a time in one's
life,

11.text:
the tick of a clock at every second,
seconds to a minute,

15.text:
minutes to a day, nothing but numbers
crossed over on a calendar at each

20.text:
Then there's Kairos. Kairos is different.
Kairos is what we make of that time.

28.text:
It's the opportune moment in someone's
life,

31.text:
the moment, the instant to make a
decision. Kairos does not follow time.

36.text: It is not bound by it. It does not rush

40.text:
nor wait. Kairos comes at you without
notice

44.text:
and you have to make a decision: avoid
it

47.text:
or face it with greatness. But don't
get me wrong;

51.text: no person is born great. We're made great.

55.text: Shaped through time, a lifetime of trial and error,

58.text:
victory and failures. For greatness
comes out a heavy hammer and a resilient

65.text:
It grows out of long days and short nights;
blood, sweat, tears.

70.text:
But true greatness is not achieved alone.
Man needs someone to mirror,

75.text:
an inspiration. Greatness is not just
knowledge,

81.text:
theories in a book. Greatness is
understanding in action,

85.text:
practice over and over. Greatness is not
the "good enough,"

89.text:
greatness is excellence, settling for
nothing but your best.

94.text:
Greatness is not landing a new trick.
It's not a conference title,

99.text:
the degree you choose, or your GPA. It's
not a piece a paper hanging on your wall.

104.text: Greatness is what you do with them.

109.text:
It's picking up your cross, embracing your
calling.

112.text:
You were not created to go with the flow; you
go with your gut. You don't blend in;

117.text:
you stand out. You don't read history; you
make it.

120.text: Be bold. Be courageous. Be who you were created to be.

124.text: Nothing can stop you or destroy you

127.text: until your work here is done.
